file_content.text: Excuse me. I must finish my reports.
Your device worked well. The droids are destroyed.
Of course it worked well! Do you think you're dealing with some fourth-tier apprentice?
Now here. It turns out they gave me a budget for testing after all.
A few weeks from now, every soldier in the Imperial Army will be fitted with one of these.
That's valuable technology I gave you! Don't just drag it around; go test it on the droids!
No! No! No! This will not do at all. I wanted expendable testers. I made that very specific on my order form.
What good does a Sith do me? If I break you, someone's going to slice my head off.
Bounty hunters cost much too much to replace. Didn't they have any slave gladiators or something?
Someone spent a lot of money to get you outfitted. They probably won't like it if I break you.
Go. And bring me back someone who no one will miss if they die.
What kind of Neimoidian orders around Imperials?
Who are you?
What are you talking about?
You're a joke.
I am Teek! I am a tier-six inventor of Research Corps Eight of the Imperial Science Bureau!
I have just designed a portable oscillator to strip the natives' droids of their shielding so the slightest blaster hit will destroy them.
Once I test it under field conditions, it can be mass manufactured and distributed to every soldier on the planet!
If this technology is valuable, it should go first to the Sith.
I can test it.
Well, as long as you don't break it. Uh, my lord.
It is fortunate we met, scientist. I will test your device against these droids.
I can test it.
Hrmph. Well, I suppose with the oscillator, you shouldn't come to any harm....
Were you planning to pay your lab rats anything?
Do you have a test budget?
Of course not! But if you guarantee that you will return the device unharmed, I might be able to scrounge up a stipend.
I'm always interested in trying out the latest technology.
Allow me.
Perfect! Maybe when we're done, I can interest you in a helmet that lets you hear alien comm signals as a constant buzzing in your left ear....
But, right! The droids....
Tell me about this device.
It collects solar radiation and oscillates it at the precise frequency to... never mind! You're no scientist. All you care is that it works, not how!
Once it's powered at a solar receptor, the oscillator is what you call "point and shoot."
I will give you the location of both the power station and the droids if you truly wish to test it for me.
Good luck. [Refuse quest]
If you find any widows or orphans, send them my way....
Do not interfere with the process of science!
